button.enableSmartWalletForTank: Enable Smart Wallet to create Tank

paragraph.introFirstParagraph: Stake PLR tokens in your tank to enable free and instant transactions between you and your contacts. PLR acts as a meta token allowing you to send and receive any asset that is supported by the Pillar Payment Network.
paragraph.introSecondParagraph: Draw from your PLR tank to send whatever you’d like.

first.title: Instant.
first.description: No waiting for miner or block confirmations. Seriously instant transactions.

second.title: Free.
second.description: No need to pay network costs or gas for any transactions.

three.title: Private.
three.description: Only final settlement is recorded on-chain. Batched transactions allow multiple transfers to be combined.

intro.title: Migrate your assets
intro.subtitle: Switch to Etherspot (Pillar V2)
intro.header: Your account is being upgraded to a Pillar Smart Wallet.
intro.body: Etherspot is multi-chain ready. Polygon, Binance Smart Chain and xDai is currently supported. Migrate assets to your new Pillar v2 wallet and enjoy DeFi with low-to-no fees.

intro.title: Time to enhance your crypto experience
intro.header: Your account is being upgraded to a Pillar Smart Wallet.

upgrade.subtitle: What is this upgrade?
upgrade.body: In a few words: Pillar is making Ethereum more accessible and laying a foundation for further improvements of Pillar platform.

benefits.secure: Keep your funds secure in the event of losing your phone or key.
benefits.ensName: Get your very own pillar.eth ENS address to use it across different platforms.
benefits.betterApp: Enjoy a refreshed user interface and improved app performance.

intro.footer: This upgrade requires a record on the blockchain. This means, a small Ethereum network fee will be added to the first transaction made with your new Pillar Smart Wallet. The fee will be extremely small thanks to Pillar Etherspot technology.

label.addLiquidityToStartEarning: Add liquidity to start earning from staking
label.stakeLiquidityToGetRewards: Stake liquidity tokens to get rewards

paragraph.whatAreLiqudityPools: Liquidity pools, in essence, are pools of tokens that are locked in a smart contract. They are used to facilitate trading by providing liquidity and are extensively used by some of the decentralized exchanges a.k.a DEXes.
paragraph.howDoLiquidityPoolsWork:
In its basic form, a single liquidity pool holds 2 tokens and each pool creates a new market for that particular pair of tokens. DAI/ETH can be a good example of a popular liquidity pool on Uniswap.

When a new pool is created, the first liquidity provider is the one that sets the initial price of the assets in the pool. The liquidity provider is incentivised to supply an equal value of both tokens to the pool. If the initial price of the tokens in the pool diverges from the current global market price, it creates an instant arbitrage opportunity that can result in lost capital for the liquidity provider. This concept of supplying tokens in a correct ratio remains the same for all the other liquidity providers that are willing to add more funds to the pool later.

When liquidity is supplied to a pool, the liquidity provider (LP) receives special tokens called LP tokens in proportion to how much liquidity they supplied to the pool. When a trade is facilitated by the pool a 0.3% fee is proportionally distributed amongst all the LP token holders. If the liquidity provider wants to get their underlying liquidity back, plus any accrued fees, they must burn their LP tokens.

Each token swap that a liquidity pool facilitates results in a price adjustment according to a deterministic pricing algorithm. This mechanism is also called an automated market maker (AMM) and liquidity pools across different protocols may use a slightly different algorithm.

intro.title: Backup your wallet
intro.subtitle: Your funds may be at risk
intro.seedPhraseWarning: On the blockchain, there is no traditional account tied to email or phone number. Instead, there is a seed phrase as your “password”. If it’s lost, your funds are lost. Make sure you have your 12 words saved nice and secure.
intro.privateKeyWarning: Your Private key is used to restore/ import your wallet in case of device loss/change or deleting your wallet. Losing private key results in loss of access to your funds.
